titleStmt.title: Receipt 373 AD
titleStmt.author: Aurelius Ptoleminos, son of Souchidas, sailor with charge of dikes

msContents.summary: Receipt for work done by Valerius on the dike of Ptolemais Harbor

msItemStruct.note: Surface rubbed and damaged in places
Written along the fibers; on the back 1 line of the docket, hardly visible
16 lines of writing by 2 different hands

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Mr. Blanchard through H.I. Bell in 1924; no. 36 in Bell

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Aurelius Ptoleminos son of Er . . ., from Ptolemais Harbor, sailor in charge of public dikes from the city of the Arsinoites, to Aurelius Valerius son of Antiourios from the village of Karanis of the Arsinoite Nome. I acknowledge the fulfillment by you of the naubia owed by you on the dike of Ptolemais Harbor, five naubia for the 1st new indiction, and I have issued to you the receipt, which is valid and secure wherever it is produced, and on formal interrogation I have given my assent.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. VII 168 Plate, P.Col. VII, Microfiche 1; correction to line 1 by Bagnall and Worp in CdE 59 (1984) 306; explanation of line 16 by Klakowicz, Stud.Pap. 21 (1982) 121-22; related texts: P.Mich X 596 and P.Col. VII 167
